lines.content: ChatGPT used for A-BetterGui, prompted ChatGPT to simulate more of a messaging app,
improving the UI and asymmetric nature of the conversations. ChatGPT was able to
update the UI, and also fix an issue where the "bye" command was not closing the UI
automatically. Overall, it saved approximately 2 hours of time, helping to improve the
ChatGPT used to improve and fix JUnit test cases and update some JavaDoc comments.

* ChoiceBot is a chatbot used to add, delete and manage tasks using command inputs.
* Constructs instance of ChoiceBot using the specified file path.
* @param filePath File used to load and save task list data.
* Runs the instance of ChoiceBot using the specified file path.
* Returns String response sent by ChoiceBot given user input.
* @param input Text input send by user to ChoiceBot.
* The entry point of the chatbot.
* Represents an exception specific to ChoiceBot.
* The exception is thrown when an error occurs during the running of ChoiceBot, such as invalid user input.
* Constructs a ChoiceBotException with the specified message explaining the error causing the exception.
* Represents a command that can be executed by ChoiceBot application.
* Each command type inherits this superclass and overrides the execute method.
* Executes the command using the given task list and user interface.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @param storage Storage used in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If an error occurs during command execution.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) throws ChoiceBotException {
* Represents a command that creates and adds a Deadline task to tasklist.
* A deadline follows the format: deadline {description} /by {yyyy-mm-dd}
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with the given description.
* @param description Contains name of Deadline, and due date.
* Executes the deadline command by creating new deadline instance.
* The deadline instance is added to given task list and saved to storage.
* Displays a confirmation message through given UI.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @param storage Storage used in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If command does not have /by, or deadline name or due date is blank.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) throws ChoiceBotException {
Task deadlineTask = new Deadline(deadlineName, false, dueDate);
assert tasks.getTaskList().contains(deadlineTask) : "Deadline task was not added to task list";
throw new ChoiceBotException("Please use format \"yyyy-mm-dd\" for deadline.");
* Throws a ChoiceBotException if description does not contain /by flag.
* Throws a ChoiceBotException if deadline name or due date is blank.
public void handleDeadlineName(String deadlineName, String dueDateString) throws ChoiceBotException {

public String execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) throws ChoiceBotException {

* Represents a command that creates and adds an Event task to tasklist.
* An Event follows the format: event {description} /from {time} /to {time}
* Constructs an EventCommand with the given description.
* @param description Contains name of Event, and start and end date/time.
* Executes the Event command by creating new Event instance.
* The Event instance is added to given task list and saved to storage.
* Displays a confirmation message through given UI.
* @param tasks Task list in current instance.
* @param ui User interface in current instance.
* @param storage Storage used in current instance.
* @throws ChoiceBotException If command does not have /from, /to, or if name, start, or end date/time missing.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) throws ChoiceBotException {
Task eventTask = new Event(eventName, false, startDate, endDate);
assert tasks.getTaskList().contains(eventTask) : "Event task was not added to task list";
throw new ChoiceBotException("Please use format \"yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm\" for start and end dates.");
* Throws a ChoiceBotException if no /from or /to flags.
* Throws a ChoiceBotException if event parameters are blank.
public void handleEventParameters(String eventName, String start, String end) throws ChoiceBotException {

throw new ChoiceBotException("Please provide a keyword to search with.");

* Represents a dialog box in the chat interface.
* Each dialog box consists of a text label and an optional avatar image.
* It supports two types of dialogs:

*
  • User dialog: right-aligned, green bubble, optionally no avatar.

*
  • ChoiceBot dialog: left-aligned, white bubble, with avatar.
* Constructs a new DialogBox by loading the FXML layout and setting the text and image.
* @param text The message text to display in the dialog box.
* @param img  The image representing the speaker (avatar).
* Creates a dialog box for the user.
* The dialog is right-aligned, uses a green bubble style, and hides the avatar image.
* @param text The message text entered by the user.
* @param img  The user's image (not displayed for chat bubble).
* @return A DialogBox instance representing the user message.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
* Creates a dialog box for the ChoiceBot.
* The dialog is left-aligned, uses a white bubble style, and displays the bot avatar.
* @param text The message text from the bot.
* @return A DialogBox instance representing the bot message.
public static DialogBox getChoiceBotDialog(String text, Image img) {

* Unit tests for the {@link DeadlineCommand} class.
* Sets up a fresh environment before each test.
* Uses a temporary test file to avoid overwriting production storage.
* Tests that a valid deadline input adds a Deadline task correctly to the TaskList.
assertEquals(1, tasks.size(), "TaskList should contain one task after adding a valid deadline");
"Task string representation should match the expected format");

* Unit tests for the {@link Task} class.
* These tests cover creating tasks, adding/deleting tasks from TaskList,
* and loading tasks from saved string formats.
* Tests that adding tasks to a TaskList increases its count.
// Adding 2 tasks should result in count of 2
assertEquals(2, tasks.getCount(), "TaskList count should be 2 after adding two tasks");
* Tests that deleting a task from TaskList decreases its count.
assertEquals(2, tasks.getCount(), "TaskList count should be 2 before deletion");
// Deleting 1 task should reduce count to 1
assertEquals(1, tasks.getCount(), "TaskList count should be 1 after deletion");

"Loaded Todo task should match expected string format");

* Tests string representation of a Todo task.
* Ensures that [X] or [ ] is displayed correctly.
Todo doneTodo = new Todo("read book", true);
assertEquals("[T][X] read book", doneTodo.toString(), "Todo marked done should have [X]");
Todo notDoneTodo = new Todo("read book", false);
assertEquals("[T][ ] read book", notDoneTodo.toString(), "Todo not done should have [ ]");
